intro: Angraecopsis brachyceras, commonly known as the short-stemmed star orchid, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, hairy stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces fragrant, white or pale blue blossoms that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its unique morphology and adaptation to harsh environments make it a fascinating subject in botanical studies. Angraecopsis brachyceras is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in specialized horticultural settings.
